text:
[8871-20161110] 1pt6floz bottle. Lemon drops and citrus passion fruit aroma. Hazy, pale yellow green body with a quick foamy white head. Bitter tart lime passion fruit flavour has a mineral line quality. Medium body has a zesty zing. Good, really interesting. (8/3/8/3/15) 3.7
(c/o blankboy, w/ him, jercraigs)
Bottle from my friend John. Pours cloudy white gold with an attractive white head and a tropical fruit aroma. There is a moderately sour pale malt flavor with a dry tart finish. Very tasty.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours hazy, lemony with a white head. Aroma of very moderately sour passion fruit. Med minus body. Flavor is moderately tart sour passion fruit. Moderately sour finish. Pretty tasty.

Bottle at Beer Hall SF. Hazy yellow color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, wheat, passion fruits, earthy notes and grass. Sour finish with citrus, earthy notes, passion fruits, grass and a bit of wheat. Excellent Berliner weisse.

22 oz bottle poured into a tulip. Hazy pale yellow with nice off-white head. Aromas of lemon lime citrus, some passion fruit and tropical fruit, a little funk. Tastes of lemon lime citrus, light tart acidic notes, some passion fruit and tropical fruit. Light body with a dry finish. Nice balance.

22, capped. Damn, thanks, R! Pours a brilliant clear bright medium gold with a loose and fizzy slosh of suds on top. Bright tangy lemon and tropical fruit nose. Creamy light body with lively carb ping ponging around. Lemons and tropical fruit on the mid palate, working perfectly together. Long tangy finish that gets dry right at the end.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Maxs place. Nice cloudy yellow. Wonderful juicy tropical fruit aroma, lactic, citric. Tart juicy flavor, lemony, lactic, with lots of passion fruit. Really great. Delicious.
At Max Place, pours yellow hazy with a nice head, aroma of grass, passion fruit, yogurt, flavor of grass, passion fruit, yogurt, sour, fresh, medium bodied, great

Bottle from Wine Tree East. Pours a hazy pineapple juice gold with a finger of foam that dissipates quickly. Huge passion fruit forward nose with some pineapple and kiwi notes. Soft, well-rounded but juicy mouthfeel. Medium carbonation. Tart but not overly so...super smooth. Awesome stuff.

Poured a light oranges yellow color from the bottle with aromas of passion fruit, light wheat, tartness some hay. Flavors aromas really light tartness, light citrus, passion fruit, solid and very enjoyable in the heat.

Hazy liquid.Ta: Medium, averagely balanced, dry and bitter taste with grape, orange and grass. Narrow taste spectrum and short aftertaste with a hint of citrus.Pa: Medium/light body with medium carbonation.Ovr: Superbly refreshing but simple.

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow-straw, large white head, dissipates leaving lots of fluffy clumpy lacing and residual. Aroma is passionfruit forward, sour mash, hints of salt. Flavor is light tart, super fruity, passionfruit, a bit salty oddly enough, sour mash, wheat, a bit of dust, mineral water. Light body, hugely crushable. Yummmy
22 ounce bottle. Huge fruity nose followed by tartness and passion fruit and mango. Very fruit forward and very good.

[My bottle (660ml) shared with j&m] Pours yellow with a green tinge and an average size lasting frothy white head. Aroma is lactic, yeasty and fruity along with some light hops, limes and passion fruit. Tart, lactic and citrusy flavour -- I get lots of lime despite there being none in it. Average to medium bodied. Not great but still quite good.

Bottles & draft on multiple occasions. Pours a bright, golden yellow body with short, frothy white head. Nose is tropical fruit, soft tart yogurt and tart fruit. Mouthfeel is tart and juicy with notes of tropical fruits, tart passionfruit, sour grapefruit pulp, guava, mango with a nice balanced acidity throughout.
22 ounce bottle. Pours a hazy pale gold with a decent white head. Aroma of tropical and citrus. Taste is passion fruit, pineapple, and lime. A winner.
Bottle from ?? - Pours yellow gold with a white head. Has a nice bright acidity and tart fruit finish. Fantastic!!

Bottle from Julio's liquors. Pours yellow with a thin head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Big passion fruit on the nose. Bright and refreshing. Lovely salty tart goodness blends nicely with the fruit. Finished clean. Awesome beer!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Cloudy yellow color. Aroma of massive passionfruit. Taste is massive tart passionfruit. Pretty damn fruity.
Pours hazy straw into a bowl. Bright white head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Passionfruit aromas. Sharp passionfruit and lacto upfront turning to marshmallow in the lasting finish.

2016-11-10. Hazy pastel yellow body with a nice fluffy white head. 3+ Aroma is quite fruity, passion fruit Im assuming, green vegetation follows. Lime like minerality.7+ Flavour is tart and sour, fruity, passion fruit. 7++ Average bodied palate, good carbonation. 3+ Pretty tasty. 7/4/7+/3/15-16 Bottle shared by Blankboy.
Very decent berliner, thanks Scott. Dry hopped citrus aroma. Lots of passion fruit flavour in the finish. Unfiltered cask look.Easy mouthfeel.

Very bright lemon rind yellow with two fingers of creamy white head. Wonderful aroma, raw passion fruit and pineapple with tropical notes and citrus rind. Light bodied and very bright/tart. Super piney. Tropical fruit and juicy acidic citrus.

Bomber drunk 10/15/16.Lightly to minimally hazy, pale, straw-golden body shows a sparkling effervescence creating a white head atop that is well-retained.Beautifully done passion fruit in the nose is highly aromatic and combines with the light lactic acid to provide intense brightness but also some earthy, funky notes, as well. Honey notes from the malt provide ample balance, with wheat providing a healthy, grainy-tartness. Tart and lovely, this is just pure passion fruit goodness. No alcohol or flaw.Acidity is actually quite gentle on the palate, as light passion fruit sugars help soften things, in concert with the soft, "chewy" wheat. Easygoing lactic character provides tartness and dryness with very light pineapple suggestions, as well as lime and guava, as the passion fruit integrates. Exquisitely tight carbonation further concentrates the wonderful flavors left behind by the fruit. No alcohol or flaw. Could drink gallons of this stuff. Especially on account of the easygoing, clean, acidity. Nothing punchy or twangy here.

Poured from bomber. Pours a light vibrant yellow, thin white head. Aroma is heavy passionfruit, lactose, strawberry, tropical fruits, gummy bears, faint oak, grassy hop. Flavor is tart passionfruit, smooth tropical fruit, faint oak, skunky grassy hop. Fruity, sour, stankily hopped quick Berliner. Good stuff!

Bomber. Light hazy yellow. Nose has a lot of passion-fruit, get a sense that there is going to be a lot of lactic sour in there. Taste is above average sour. Some passionfruit, but almost covered up by the sourness. Light and crisp. I was told this compared to Miami Madness, its on the right track, but still several steps behind.

22oz bottle pours a hazy yellow with some ringing, white head. Nose is tart with lemon and grapefruit and passion fruit, mild green grape. Flavor is tart with grapefruit pith and passion fruit, very fruity. Finishes tart and refreshing.

650 ml bottle shared by ClarkVV. Bright hazy yellow in appearance. Aroma has an ass ton of passion fruit just with the lightest note of tart funk.
Flavor is mostly passion fruit purée with a very mild tartness in the finish. I like it, it does taste good. But to me it the passion fruit covers any other flavor that wanted to be here. I solely taste fruit juice. Good light body and proper carbonation. For a fruited Berliner, it is very easy to drink!

2016/10/15 - Pours a cloudy, deep straw colour with a thick, soapy, white head that slowly reduces and leaves minimal patchy lacing. Aroma is big juicy tropical fruits (pineapple, guava, passionfruit), tart lemon, stonefruit, light funk and light wheat. Taste follows nose, tart lemon, tangerine, juicy passionfruit, light wheat with a hint of funk. Mouthfeel is medium with biting carbonation and a tart, juicy finish. Light, fruity and crisp.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at Blind Tiger, pours a cloudy yellow with a medium white head. Aroma brings out loads of fresh passion fruit, followend by a little lacto. Flavour is along the same lines, with lots of passion fruit, with lots of zest and a little lacto. Robust and wonderfully constructed. Really good.

Bottle at Als, pours a bright hazy yellow golden shade with average head. Notes are super juicy and banging Passionfruit. Other notes of guava flesh, tangerine, blood orange. Salivating and insanely tropical. Almost as good as Brewski Passionfeber or old passionfruit funky buddha berliner

Bottle from Whole Foods-Chelsea. Bright yellow pour with a fizzy white head. Lively fruity aroma, passion fruit, tart lime and lemon, funky notes and some oak hints as well. Tastes tart and fruity. Bright and flavorful. Finishes a bit dry. Super refreshing, tart beer with a nice mouthfeel. Lively carbonation tingles on the mouth. This is really quite good. Hard to believe all this flavor is packed into a 4% ABV beer.

Bottle at home for the Patriots Thursday night game, been saving this brew all week for this game and dissapoint. Lighter yellow orange pour smallish head. Nose is amazing lovely tropical fruits and citrus and lactose. Tastes of just right passionfruit, lime, some lemon amd apricot, yogurt, and some nice hop bitterness to round it out. Great end of summer brew just fits.

Bottle, from Highcraft beer market, Cary NC. Real good aroma,fruity lactose. Lemon, passion fruit brings tropical notes. Mild sour tart. Tad hazed golden yellow color, ok head , faded quickly away, no lace. Medium sweet and sour flavor. Light body, thin smooth creamy mouthfeel, medium sour finish, oy, that damn tasty. Aroma is wonderful. Great mix of fruit and sour. In the aroma, flavor little more sore than sweet. Light body, thin creamy mouthfeel, moderate sour, lghtly sweet finish. Damn good beer
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle - pours yellow gold white head - nose/taste of lactose sourness, passionfruit, tropical fruit funk - lighter medium body
Bottle. Hazy yellow pour with white head. Passion fruit, citrus, tart fruit aromas. Light tart passion fruit, oak, funky flavors.
